page.title: 02FARMING IN SWINFORD
page.content: The main{land usage}is cattle, sheep and dairy farming. Much of the land was once part of the now reduced{ {Stanford Hall}estate, home of Lord and Lady Braye. There are a number of fox coverts, and sporadic lines of deciduous trees border the roads and fields which are divided by low hedges. Recent field enlargements and Dutch Elm disease have depleted the tree cover. Twelve{farmers}work the area of twelve square kilometres - some having land elsewhere. Seven farmers live in Swinford village itself.
